captions.text: So they are more powerful than they look.
With this stunt we will demonstrate steering precision ...
We are gonna drive forward, of course?
So what will happen is that...
I will demonstrate on these two model trucks:
The trucks will be placed closely together.
And you will be standing on the side mirrors.
after a while they will slowly separate.
And you will perform one of your famous splits...
... with one foot on each side mirror.
On each side mirror – of each truck?
And they are gonna open up?
They are gonna open up slowly.
So you have plenty of time to perform the split.
I mean, if they keep on opening up I can fall down ...
But after a while they will stop opening up ...
... and they will keep the distance.
Thank you Jan Inge. Thank you so much.
I heard that you went to a flamenco bar the other day?
When we are finished with the shooting - if I'm not dead...
The Epic Split starring Jean-Claude Van Damme.

comments.text:
Love you dad your son in Jacksonville Florida who is waiting for you with a 
broken heart Jorge van damn Cruz ﻿

comments.text:
Just wondering why some people are saying he had all kind of protection and 
all, watch the video "PEOPLE ARE AWESOME (Hadouken! - Mecha Love)", and you 
see that people CAN do amazing things. I'm not saying he didn't have any 
kind of protection, they said he had a support wire there in case he fell, 
but saying he had everything to prevent him from falling is stupid, it's 
like saying no one can do amazing things.﻿
comments.author: Squall Leonhart

comments.text:
+chcastro100 Didn't you read my comment? I said that Van Damme only had a 
few wires on his body. So in-case he fell, he would actually FALL, but a 
bungee cord would stop him.
comments.author: Monster of Luckiness

comments.text:
He had such safety protection that any strong athlete could have performed 
this stunt.  They employed VanDamme only to make it appear like it was a 
superhuman feat (not that VanDamme is superhuman).  It certainly wowed the 
gullible.
comments.author: chcastro100

comments.text:
+Monster of Luckiness That's what I meant, but some people are treating the 
case as if he was pasted on the trucker and nothing could make him fall.
comments.author: Squall Leonhart

comments.text:
He did have protection, but the whole stunt was performed in one take. 
There was a little something holding his ankles, and in-case he fell, the 
straps would let him fall down a bit, until it tensions up like a seatbelt. 
So pretty much, he did it with no help at all. Just with safety if he DID 
fall.

comments.text:
+Tilek Mamutov well yeah there is no denying that it sounds scripted I 
agree to that. And it is. I'm just saying that it tries at least to mimic 
how the actual conversation would of went down. I am guessing such things 
were already discussed off camera to the detail long before this, and then 
of course they simply scripted it out into this video and showed us that 
part specifically just so we know about it and to point it out to us :P
comments.author: DCF - HazardReborn

comments.text:
+HazaRDReborN +MidwestPCTV Thanks for replies. I mostly agree with both of 
you, I just think the way he phrased it did not sound natural and made it 
sound more scripted in my humble opinion. Overall I absolutely loved the ad 
of course!
comments.author: Tilek Mamutov

comments.text:
+1 /\ Yep, Drive backwards in a huge Semi and at just a small amount of 
speed one small problem can lead to nasty problem's.
comments.author: MidwestPCTV

comments.text:
A professional maybe? Even though it is scripted, you would still ask all 
these questions even if it wasn't. Attention to detail in all fields is 
what makes the difference between an amateur and a pro. I doubt a stunt man 
would go ahead to make a stunt without asking the details of what exactly 
they are doing, movement direction, the set and pretty much every single 
thing that has to do with the stunt. Otherwise we would be asking for new 
stunt men crews every day from accidents. Oh, and he is an actor and 
director......... I doubt he would leave a question such as this out in 
real life.
comments.author: DCF - HazardReborn
